title: pkgdepR
text: {pkgdepR} created solve particular problem faced developing interrelated R packages within organizations. Oftentimes, want see (visually) functions one package interacted functions another package. particularly useful managing function dependencies across large code base R packages.

title: pkgdepR
text: {pkgdepR} simply takes argument vector package names (already search path) explores functions namespaces interact. two stages: Getting intra-package function dependencies package; Getting inter-package function dependencies combination packages. defined name particular package’s namespace also function decomposed. decomposition, function found called within contents, link created. properly identify distinct name calls, search done package tag preceding name (.e. ::). tag exists, search imported function conducted. hand, function name already declared primary namespace, obviously function called. function ambiguously called (without package tag explicitly imported another namespace) deliberately ignored linkage. linkage environment-dependent change depending contents search path particular session.

title: pkgdepR
text: main wrapper function {pkgdepR} pkgdepR::deps(...) returns object class pkgdepR. S3 method created objects class pkgdepR can easily plotted. See ?pkgdepR::plot.pkgdepR details. implemented methods class :
code: methods(class = "pkgdepR") #> [1] plot    print   summary #> see '?methods' for accessing help and source code

title: pkgdepR
text: Objects class  can plot using plot(...). visualization, functions exported namespace shown circles, whilst non-exported functions shown squares. arrow go square node another node different colour.

title: pkgdepR
text: can install released version {pkgdepR} CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: pkgdepR
text: ’ll show example use {pkgdepR} using test packages hosted GitHub. First, let’s load required example packages. required packages now added search path.

title: pkgdepR
text: Create pkgdepR object follows: can see summary object see network visualization, simply call plot.
code: v = pkgdepR::deps(pkg = "testpkg1") v # alternatively, summary(v) or print(v) #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    testpkg1 #> Total nodes: 8 #> Total links: 7 #>   -Between packages: 0 #>   -Within packages:  7 #>     --Between functions: 6 #>     --Self-referential:  1 plot(v, height = "500px", main = list(text = NULL))

title: pkgdepR
text: Visualizing multiple packages works similar way. ’s simple ! Back top
code: v = pkgdepR::deps(pkg = c("testpkg1", "testpkg2")) v # alternatively, summary(v) or print(v) #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    testpkg1, testpkg2 #> Total nodes: 16 #> Total links: 20 #>   -Between packages: 10 #>   -Within packages:  10 #>     --Between functions: 8 #>     --Self-referential:  2 plot(v, height = "700px", main = list(text = NULL), option = "E")

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ed Peyton (2022). package tracking visualizing package function dependencies. URL: https://pkgdepr.org/.
code: @Misc{pkgdepR,   title = {pkgdepR: A package for tracking and visualizing package function dependencies},   author = {Ed Peyton},   year = {2022},   url = {https://pkgdepr.org}, }

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies
text: ever wanted visualize dependencies functions group R packages developed? try using {pkgdepR}! {pkgdepR} takes number (correctly compiled) R packages finds links function namespaces.

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies
text: {pkgdepR} created solve particular problem faced developing interrelated R packages within organizations. Oftentimes, want see (visually) functions one package interacted functions another package. particularly useful managing function dependencies across large code base R packages.

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies
text: {pkgdepR} simply takes argument vector package names (already search path) explores functions namespaces interact. two stages: Getting intra-package function dependencies package; Getting inter-package function dependencies combination packages. defined name particular package’s namespace also function decomposed. decomposition, function found called within contents, link created. properly identify distinct name calls, search done package tag preceding name (.e. ::). tag exists, search imported function conducted. hand, function name already declared primary namespace, obviously function called. function ambiguously called (without package tag explicitly imported another namespace) deliberately ignored linkage. linkage environment-dependent change depending contents search path particular session.

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies
text: main wrapper function {pkgdepR} pkgdepR::deps(...) returns object class pkgdepR. S3 method created objects class pkgdepR can easily plotted. See ?pkgdepR::plot.pkgdepR details. {pkgdepR} makes use fantastic visNetwork package creating interactive network visualization functions present R packages. implemented methods class :
code: methods(class = "pkgdepR") #> [1] plot    print   summary #> see '?methods' for accessing help and source code

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies
text: links functions determined statically, meaning dependencies identified without executing code. , functions defined dynamically run-time picked . example , foo() picked declared package’s namespace. However, bar() picked defined run-time foo() called. Similarly, can cases linkages created may occur run-time. Let’s add previous example, adding function bar() declared package namespace interested . , statically, appears foo() calling bar() namespace interested . However, run-time, know case, bar() clearly defined locally local function called. instance, pkgdepR show link package::foo() package::bar() real run-time dependency exists. cases rarely arise normal package development, important aware behaviour nonetheless.
code: # @title foo function # @export foo = function() { # - this will be picked up!    bar = function() { # - this won't be picked up!      }      bar()  } # @title bar function # @export bar = function() { # - this will be picked up!  }

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies
text: Create pkgdepR object follows: can see summary object see network visualization, simply call plot.
code: v = pkgdepR::deps(pkg = "testpkg1") v # alternatively, summary(v) or print(v) #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    testpkg1 #> Total nodes: 8 #> Total links: 7 #>   -Between packages: 0 #>   -Within packages:  7 #>     --Between functions: 6 #>     --Self-referential:  1 plot(dep)

title: Statically Determine Function Dependencies
text: Visualizing multiple packages works similar way.
code: v = pkgdepR::deps(pkg = c("testpkg1", "testpkg2")) v # alternatively, summary(v) or print(v) #>  #> pkgdepR object #> ------------------------------ #> Packages:    testpkg1, testpkg2 #> Total nodes: 16 #> Total links: 20 #>   -Between packages: 10 #>   -Within packages:  10 #>     --Between functions: 8 #>     --Self-referential:  2 plot(v)
